title: Ticket #164: Log rotation tests timing out
description: The log rotation tests are timing out; I had previously thought that it was entirely an issue with the tests, but, after solving those problems, I'm still seeing problems on 64-bit machines. I've been able to reproduce it on my openSUSE 11.1 laptop, and I think it's likely that there's a real performance problem in the UserLog -- I don't know for certain yet that it's not in the test program, but I think it's unlikely. I also don't know yet whether the problem goes away with log rotation turned off. I need to do some profiling to understand the problem better.
remarks:
2009-Jun-01 11:44:08 by nleroy:

Summary as of 1 June 2009

  1. Details
    • In the test results for the past month, there has been a total of 10 timeouts
      • 4 on the trunk
      • 6 on V7-2

    • All of these failures are in -defaults test
      • Last trunk failure: 16 May 2009
      • Last V7_2 failure: 20 May 2009
      • All of these failures have been on "nmi:x86 64_fc_9" "Cross of nmi:x86 64_rhap_5".

  2. Trunk
    • There have been no related code changes in the time window between the last failure and the stretch of successes
    • NMI Test Results

  3. V7_2-branch
    • There were some changes to the user log code during this window. I don't think that they're related to the failures for several reasons:
      • None of these changes should affect the performance of the log writer
      • These changes occurred during the window of failures; there were failures both before and after these changes were committed.
      • These changes were pushed to the trunk after the last failure on the trunk
    • NMI Test Results
creator: nleroy
